TEXT: The applicant was a NORP citizen of NORP national origin , born in GPE in DATE .
He died in GPE on DATE . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE his daughter expressed the wish to maintain the case before the ORG .

Before the declaration restoring GPE ’s independence on DATE , the applicant worked as a lawyer in GPE . From DATE until DATE he was the Deputy Head of the so - called ORG ( hereinafter referred to as the “ LSPO ” ) , a division of the centralised ORG of the GPE . Following the failure of a communist “ coup d’état ” in GPE on DATE and the immediate dismantling of the NORP institutions , most of the ORG ’s activists fled GPE . The former Head of the LSPO , PERSON , moved to GPE . Yet the applicant stayed in GPE and acquired NORP citizenship .

Until the GPE coup of CARDINAL DATE the ORG had been located in a building in the centre of GPE . The prosecuting authority of the newly re - established state of GPE was also based in the same building . The applicant , as the Deputy Head of the LSPO , had been in charge of administration . The building had been protected by the interior forces of the GPE .

The applicant was suspected of preventing the prosecutors in the service of independent GPE from having access to their offices during the period from DATE to DATE . On DATE he was arrested , the arrest being confirmed by a prosecutor . On DATE he was formally charged with sabotage and the obstruction of the operation of State institutions .
On DATE the applicant was released from prison and remanded on bail .
On DATE the pre - trial investigation was concluded and the criminal case was transmitted to ORG .

At the same time , the applicant submitted to ORG numerous applications and pleadings alleging various procedural irregularities committed by the prosecution while conducting the pre - trial investigation . In his pleadings of DATE the applicant also asserted that the prosecutor ’s arguments in support of his guilt were ill - founded , and that the case - file contained no valid evidence .

On DATE ORG decided to order further investigation of the case . The above decision was subsequently quashed as , following amendments to domestic criminal procedure , on DATE ORG transmitted the case for a completely new examination to ORG . During the trial , CARDINAL witnesses were questioned , including a number of officers who worked for the prosecuting authority of independent GPE during DATE .

By a letter of CARDINAL DATE a prosecutor requested the President of ORG to invalidate the applicant ’s passport for the purposes of foreign travel . The prosecutor stated , on the basis of certain intelligence received , that the applicant intended to move to GPE in order to avoid trial . Apparently the prosecutor ’s request was granted .

On DATE a chamber of judges of ORG held a final hearing of the case . The applicant was represented by an officially appointed lawyer , but also made an intervention defending himself in person . The first instance court convicted him . It replaced however the initial charges of sabotage and obstruction , finding the applicant guilty of restraining the freedom of movement of third persons . ORG did not impose any sentence because of an amnesty law .
Both the prosecution and the applicant appealed against the above judgment .
On DATE a chamber of ORG held a hearing on the appeal on points of law . The court decided to relinquish jurisdiction in favour of the full court .

On DATE ORG held a full appeal hearing . The applicant was represented by his own defence counsel , but also made an intervention himself . He requested inter alia that the court call and question the former Head of the LSPO , PERSON , who lived near GPE and worked as a NORP military prosecutor .
On DATE ORG amended the judgment of DATE , convicting the applicant of sabotage and the obstruction of the operation of ORG institutions . He was sentenced to DATE imprisonment .

The applicant lodged a cassation appeal with ORG . He contested the fact - finding competence of both lower courts . He alleged inter alia that he had never received a copy of the first instance judgment in LANGUAGE , a language that he would understand , and that thus he had been unable to prepare a proper appeal . In his cassation appeal the applicant made no allegations as to the composition of the appellate court .

On DATE a chamber of ORG heard the cassation appeal in the presence of the applicant and his defence counsel . At the hearing the applicant challenged the assessment of the ORG evidence by the lower courts .

ORG found that ORG had properly decided the case . It also dismissed as unsubstantiated the applicant ’s allegations that the appellate court had breached any domestic procedural requirements to the applicant ’s detriment . ORG noted that a copy of the first instance judgment in LANGUAGE was furnished to the applicant on DATE , whereas the term for submitting an appeal had expired on DATE . ORG found that this fact had constituted a breach of domestic criminal procedure . The cassation court also noted , however , that the above irregularity had been remedied by the appellate court which had granted the applicant DATE to supplement his appeal . The case had then been examined by ORG based on the applicant ’s revised appeal .
On DATE the applicant died of a heart disease .
